title: Designing a Language-Based Constraint Approach for Team Sports Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience, understanding of basic sports vocabulary and situational expressions
context.additional_context: Team sports simulation and collaborative task environment for language domain application. Learners engage in language activities such as acquiring specialized terminology, writing tactical explanations, and developing inter-team communication strategies during game analysis.

learning_goals: Learners analyze ten or more team sports (e.g., soccer, basketball) game videos, identify five or more situational language variables (e.g., tactical instructions, communication patterns), and achieve over 80% accuracy in predicting behavioral possibilities based on simulations.
Designing representative language learning environments using constraints and inducing changes in team interaction communication strategies.

During a 6-month long-term training course, learners create a training plan including weekly/monthly/quarterly language goals (grammar, vocabulary, expressions) and revise behavior adaptation strategies with over 80% accuracy based on actual training data (communication frequency, response accuracy).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
